dcterms:creator: N. Golenvaux
P. Gonzalez Alvarez
H. Silvère Kiossou
P. Schaus
dcterms:description: Google Trends data is used to capture the relative quantities of web searches for specific keywords related to migration, allowing for the modeling and forecasting of international migration flows.
dcterms:title: Google Trends Data

dcterms:creator: M. H. Böhme
A. Gröger
T. Stöhr
dcterms:description: The OECD International Migration Database provides yearly incoming migratory flow data from 101 countries of origin to 35 OECD countries, along with demographic and economic data.
dcterms:title: OECD International Migration Database

dcterms:creator: World Bank
dcterms:description: World Development Indicators provide a comprehensive set of data on various economic and demographic indicators that are essential for understanding migration dynamics.
dcterms:title: World Development Indicators

dcterms:creator: M. N. Ahmed
G. Barlacchi
S. Braghin
M. Ferretti
V. Lonij
R. Nair
R. Novack
J. Paraszczak
A. S. Toor
dcterms:description: The GDELT Project provides a global database of events, language, and tone, which can be utilized for analyzing migration patterns and trends through event data.
dcterms:title: GDELT Project (Global Database of Events, Language, and Tone)

dcterms:creator: M. H. Böhme
A. Gröger
T. Stöhr
dcterms:description: Migration data from Böhme et al. focuses on predicting international migration using online search keywords, providing insights into migration intentions.
dcterms:title: Migration Data from Böhme et al.
